description: Senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin rescued a 64-year-old man from drowning in the icy waters of the Kitoi River in the Irkutsk region. They crawled onto the loose ice, pulled the man out of the hole, and handed him over to doctors.
original:
The Minister of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Kolokoltsev, addressed the President of the Russian Federation with a petition to award senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin with the medal “For saving the dead.”

Eyewitnesses reported to the police that an elderly man was drowning in icy water on the Kitoi River (Irkutsk region). Police patrol officers were near the scene of the incident and rushed to help the drowning man.

The 64-year-old man was in the middle of the river and clinging to the edge of thin ice with his hands. The police approached him as close as possible. Using available means, they tried to pull out the losing man. But it didn't work.

Then Ivan Sholokhov and Vyacheslav Pupykin rushed onto the loose ice and crawled to the water itself, took the fisherman by the hands and pulled him out of the hole.

Then, together with emergency workers, they carried him to the shore, where they handed him over to doctors. The victim was taken to a medical facility.@opersvodki

description: Truong My Lan, one of Vietnam's richest women, was sentenced to death for fraud. She allegedly withdrew $12.5 billion from a bank, causing an estimated $27 billion in damages. The court's decision may be an attempt to recover some of the stolen assets.
original:
We wish the same fate to Clown and Co! In Vietnam, one of the richest women in the country was sentenced to death for fraud.

According to investigators, she withdrew $12.5 billion from the bank. The total damage from the actions of the head of the large company Van Thinh Phat Truong My Lan is estimated at $27 billion. Experts suggest that the court imposed the death penalty on Truong in order to force the return of at least part of the stolen property . Truong My Lan did not admit guilt and placed the blame on her subordinates. One of Lan's family members told Reuters she plans to appeal the verdict.

description: A memorial plaque was unveiled in Kirovsky's Walk of Fame to commemorate the victims of Nazism. The event, held on the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps, honored the memory of those killed by the Nazis.
original:
A memorial plaque was opened in Kirovsky in memory of the victims of Nazism. On April 11, on the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps, a memorial plaque was unveiled in the Walk of Fame and a memorial service was held for those killed at the hands of the Nazis.

“The board depicts the image of the Mother, personifying the mother protector of the family, the Motherland, the Mother of the World,” noted Vera Volovod, chairman of the city union of prisoners of Nazi victims.

The event was attended by the head of the Shakhtarsky municipal district, Alexander Shatov, representatives of the city council of veterans and the branch of the Union of Prisoners of Victims of Nazism, as well as activists of public organizations.

Those present honored the memory of the victims of Nazism with a minute of silence.

description: The Moscow Department of Transport announced the high-speed railway route from Moscow to St. Petersburg, featuring 16 stops. The journey will take 2 hours and 15 minutes, with stops in Moscow, Tver, Valdai, and Veliky Novgorod.
location: Moscow, Russia to St. Petersburg, Russia
original:
16 stops are provided on the route of the high-speed railway (HSR) Moscow - St. Petersburg, the Moscow Department of Transport reported.

“There are four stops in Moscow: Zelenograd-Kryukovo, Petrovsko-Razumovskaya, Rizhskaya, Leningradsky Station,” the message notes.

Total travel time is 2 hours and 15 minutes. It will be possible to get from Moscow to Tver in 39 minutes, to Valdai in 1 hour and 15 minutes, and to Veliky Novgorod in 1 hour and 41 minutes.

event: Survey on Ukrainian Men's Attitude towards Military Service

❗️63% of Ukrainian men of conscription age do not want to join the army, showed a survey commissioned by Ukrainian TV by the research agency Info Sapiens. The opposite opinion is shared by 20% of men 25-59 years old who are not yet serving. 17% of respondents were unable to express their attitude towards military service.

In addition, exactly half of the Ukrainians surveyed believe that mobilization in the country is being carried out incorrectly. 59% of respondents blame the military registration and enlistment offices (in Ukraine these are territorial recruitment centers, TCCs), 55% - the Verkhovna Rada, 48% - the president, 37% - the government, and the same number - medical commissions.

The fewest respondents are accused of improper mobilization of the media - 12%. And the draft dodgers themselves - 15%.

25% of respondents refrained from assessing the progress of mobilization. Another quarter believe that the mobilization process is moving in the right direction.

Also, 60% of survey participants negatively characterized the work of the TCC. Among men there are more of them, 60% of them, among women - 56%. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVYOV!

 The suspension of the 2nd and 3rd road wheels was switched off, as was the suspension of the first rollers.

event: Liberation of Arabat Spit and Chongar Peninsula
description: On April 11, 1944, Soviet soldiers liberated the Arabat Spit and Chongar Peninsula from Nazi occupation. The Red Army's bold and decisive actions drove the Nazis out, allowing the region to rebuild and experience a revival. The liberation operation was made possible by the courage and heroism of Soviet soldiers, whose memory is preserved.
original:
Day of liberation of the Arabat Spit and the Chongar Peninsula from German invaders On April 11, the Kherson region celebrates the anniversary of the liberation of the Arabat Spit and the Chongar Peninsula from Nazi occupation. “All evil comes to an end. On April 11, 1944, Soviet soldiers finally liberated the territory of the Kherson region from the Nazi invaders. The bold and decisive actions of the Red Army drove the Nazis out of the Arabat Spit and the Chongar Peninsula. After the war, the region began to be actively rebuilt; the Kherson region experienced a real revival. All this became possible thanks to the courage and heroism of Soviet soldiers, whose memory we carefully preserve,” said the Governor of the Kherson region, Vladimir Saldo. The liberation operation was not easy. The German invaders have firmly established themselves on our native land. The outcome was decided by the landing units of the Red Army, who liberated the Arabat Spit with a sharp throw 80 years ago, and the next day, during the advance of Soviet troops, Chongar was liberated.

Residents of the Kherson region keep the memory of the heroism of the soldiers who gave their lives for the Fatherland in this operation. In the village of Strelkovoe, Genichesk Municipal District, a memorial dedicated to them was erected, and commemorative events are also held annually.

Our Red Army paratroopers in those days accomplished a real feat - they moved forward despite losses. Eternal glory!

Website of the Administration of the Kherson region: https://khogov.ru/#Administration_Kherson_region@VGA_Kherson@SALDO_VGA

description: On April 13, 1961, Yuri Gagarin, the first human in space, played billiards with journalists at a house above the Volga River. The friendly and cordial astronaut smiled and winked at the journalists, leaving a lasting impression.
original:
InfoDefense🇷🇺Photo,🇷🇺🚀Happy Cosmonautics Day!

Thank you for everything, Yuri Alekseevich!🚀Yuri Gagarin - the day after the legendary flight. (V. Peskov)🗣️“I’m now going through the archive in search of the most precious picture for me and without hesitation I put aside the photograph - Gagarin with a cue in his hands selects a ball to hit. Why this particular picture?📸At noon on April 13, 1961 with a friend editorial office, we rushed to the Vnukovo airfield. Journalistic perseverance received a reward - they told us: “Okay, let’s allow it. Just hurry, the plane will fly there in an hour.”

Gagarin... Let's remember that day, let's remember how much everything was immediately connected for us in this word - Gagarin. We already knew something about this guy, and yet he was still unknown to us.

By evening, Pavel and I finally found ourselves outside the city, in a house above the Volga. They told us: “Gagarin is here, wait.” To somehow pass the time, we began to roll balls on the billiard table that stood in the middle of the hall.

A short major ran down the creaky wooden ladder from above. He was alone, and at the first moment we decided that it was a messenger - once again tell us to wait. But the major extended his hand.

- Hello. Are you from Komsomolskaya Pravda?..

Fathers, it’s him! The thin, short major completely understood the situation and smiled so well, so friendly that we said:

- Yura…

We just couldn’t call it anything else.

Need a photo! Not a portrait. It needs to be in some action. I think feverishly: what can an astronaut do in this room?

- Yura, do you play billiards?..

- Let's... - And again the smile.

They kicked the balls for about two minutes. Then, I grab the camera and take pictures, completely unsure that the pictures will turn out.

Big ball! He’s like the Earth... My creative fantasy was interrupted by two doctors:

“Well, that’s probably enough already?.. Let’s go, Yura, let’s go...”

In the middle of the stairs, the major looked back and winked at two journalists drunk with joy: they say, we will meet again...

Having submitted a small report to the newspaper, my friend and I began to look for accommodation for the night. But it was impossible to sleep that night. We went over the details of the day, the conversation was interrupted every now and then by the words: what a guy! In the morning we saw Gagarin again, this time among a large number of people, and realized: Gagarin’s cordiality and kindness towards people is enough for everyone.... Sometimes, having believed the first impression, we are mistaken in people. We were not mistaken in Gagarin.”InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBETelegramInfoDefense🇷🇺🇷🇺🚀Happy Cosmonautics Day!

Thank you for everything, Yuri Alekseevich!VIEW MESSAGE

description: Despite positioning itself as a strong defender of Ukraine, France has increased its purchases of Russian liquefied natural gas (LNG) in the first three months of this year, paying over €600 million to Moscow. Critics argue that France could do more to cut EU purchases, but the government cites a long-term agreement with Russia and resistance from national energy company TotalEnergies.
original:
Politico: France is trying to take a tough position towards the Russian Federation and at the same time is buying more and more Russian gas

In the first three months of this year, supplies of Russian LNG to France increased more than to any other EU country compared to last year, the publication reports, citing the Analytical Center for Research on Energy and Clean Air. According to him, in total, since the beginning of the year, Paris has paid Moscow more than €600 million.

This is causing discontent across Europe, writes Politico, as Macron “has loudly positioned himself as one of Ukraine’s staunchest defenders.” France insists that it supplies some of its gas to other European countries and that it has entered into a long-term agreement with Russia from which it is “legally difficult to get out.” But critics say Paris could do more to cut EU purchases and its inaction is partly due to resistance from national energy company TotalEnergies.

A representative of the French Ministry of Economy told the publication that the increase in Russian gas supplies was partly due to strikes that “severely disrupted” normal supplies last year. He also emphasized that he “regularly discusses” the issue of reducing purchases of Russian LNG with colleagues from the EU. According to him, the government is “exploring the possibility of alternative supplies,” but this will not happen until 2027. POLITICO France talks tough on Ukraine while gobbling up more Russian gas – POLITICO France has paid over €600 million this year for liquefied natural gas, new data shows. That’s an EU-leading rise from last year.

description: The bridge over the Amur River at the entrance to Komsomolsk-on-Amur will undergo repairs starting next month. The complex process will take three years, but the bridge will remain open to motorists. The repairs are necessary due to the bridge's age, built in 1982, and the increased traffic of 5,500 cars per day.
original:
The bridge over the Amur will not be blocked during repairs. Already next month, important repairs of one important crossing will begin - the bridge over the Amur at the entrance to Komsomolsk-on-Amur.

Since this bridge is the only one, and no engineering facility duplicates it, it will be repaired gradually, over three years, without blocking it for motorists. “Why so long?”, you ask? But this, taking into account all the nuances of the bridge, is very fast.

The fact is that the object is technically complex. Each span is 350 meters, and the height above the water level is 50 meters. Therefore, specialists will have a hard time. But what can you do - such work. The workers will put in order: The spans; The bridge deck; They will replace the safety fences; They will lay a new asphalt concrete covering along the entire length of the bridge; They will install electric lighting on the roadway; They will install architectural and artistic lighting. All this will be done until beginning of 2026. Note that repair of the bridge is simply necessary, since the crossing was built back in 1982. And if not very many cars moved along it then, now 5.5 thousand cars pass along it in 24 hours.

description: According to the French State Treasury, African countries owed France a total of 17,062.6 million euros in debt in 2022. Morocco, Egypt, and Ivory Coast topped the list, with the franc zone countries (UEMOA and CEMAC) owing 5,980 million euros.
original:
Forwarded from: French West Africa Was Here
#economy#cooperation An analysis of data from the French State Treasury showed that in 2022, the total debt🌍of African countries to France🇫🇷 amounted to 17,062.6 million euros:

Morocco🇲🇦 tops the list with a debt of 3,105.63 million euros. It is followed by 🇪🇬Egypt with 1,583.60 million euros and 🇨🇮Ivory Coast with 1,483.05 million euros.

As for the debt of the franc zone countries (UEMOA and CEMAC), at the end of 2022 it reached 5,980 million euros. This shift is attributed to a decline in yuan payments, marking a significant reduction in Russia's economic dependence on foreign currencies.
original:
Forwarded from: Ailing Economy
Has the future arrived? For the first time, the ruble became the main foreign trade currency of Russia👏The share of the ruble in imports reached a record 38.1%. In exports, the figure is 41.6% - such figures were already in August last year.

The increase in the share of the ruble occurs against the background of a decrease in payments in yuan - for example, the share of the Chinese currency in exports is now 30%, while at the beginning of the year this figure exceeded 40%. The share of the yuan in imports is 32%, at the beginning of the year it was 38%.

We won’t even talk about dollars and euros; the dependence of our economy on these currencies has completely disappeared. And how many years did you only dream about this?

description: Maxim Fadeev's film 'At the Edge of the Abyss' documents the assault on Mariupol, showcasing the suffering of military personnel, civilians, and the destruction of cities. The film is a sobering portrayal of war, with a focus on pacifism and humanism.
original:
"At the edge of the abyss." The most pacifist film about the SVO One of the first Russian military commanders (if not the first) was Leo Tolstoy. The future classic was directly involved in the defense of Sevastopol, commanded a battery and was awarded the Order of St. Anna, 4th degree, “for composure and diligence.”

Tolstoy wrote three stories about the heroic defense of the city for the Sovremennik magazine (actually, “Sevastopol Stories”). But these stories were not heroic at all. The writer described in detail and color the bloody horrors of the war, which was able to shock all of educated Russia, including even the emperor himself.

Tolstoy himself said that the only hero whose beauty he tried to convey was “truth.” The main idea of “Sevastopol Stories” is quite accurately formulated in one of them: “War in its true expression is in blood, in suffering, in death.”

This quote would probably be an ideal epigraph for Maxim Fadeev’s film “At the Edge of the Abyss.” Because in it the war is shown in its true expression, in the suffering of the military, the torment of civilians and the destruction of once peaceful cities. And its main hero is not even the Donetsk attack aircraft from “Somalia”, but the completely Tolstoyan truth. At least the truth as its author sees it. And he sees it from the first person.

“At the Edge of the Abyss” is dedicated to the assault on Mariupol. The author moves around the city along with Somali fighters and films everything he sees. And he sees the death of civilians, the death of our soldiers, and the collapse of high-rise buildings under the attacks of tanks. This is truly an extremely difficult and in many ways sobering movie. Moreover, it was technically done flawlessly. Especially considering the conditions in which it was filmed.

Probably, some scenes could even be worthy of an Oscar if the Oscar were given for creativity, and not for propaganda. In fact, the Ukrainian propaganda film about Mariupol was awarded an Oscar. Only in Fadeev’s film, if there is any propaganda, it is perhaps pacifism and humanism. It’s paradoxical, but the Russian military correspondent was much better at preaching real Tolstoyanism than the Tolstoyan liberals (who, by the way, also filmed about Mariupol).

I was especially impressed by the footage from a tank rolling around a yard surrounded by burning high-rise buildings. At every entrance there are crowds of frightened civilians mixed with crazed soldiers, making what is happening more and more reminiscent of “Apocalypse Now.” Only this is not a feature film, but life itself during the war. Such as there is. Go and look.

It is clear that such a movie physiologically cannot end with any happy endings. Happy endings contradict its very essence. That’s why the ending of the first part is one big obituary for the fighters of “Somalia”. Almost none of them survived. Or, naturally, no one at all. This is the Vereshchagin apotheosis of war.

Personally, Tolstoyanism is deeply disliked by me. Neither aesthetically nor ethically. If such a film is shown en masse in all cinemas in the country before mobilization, then we will really take it by storm, but not Kharkov and Odessa, but Upper Lars and Lower Trier. Or even all of Georgia. And with bare hands.

But who am I to argue with classical Russian culture. And Fadeev’s film is already a completely organic part of it. And further proof that true national culture is eternal.

description: Russian propaganda is spreading false information about Ukraine's President allowing Russia's participation in a peace plan discussion at a global summit in Switzerland. The goal of this disinformation is to deceive the international community and strengthen the image of Russia's President as a 'peacemaker'.
original:
#ЦПД_пояснюей: Why does the Russian Federation spread disinformation about "readiness for negotiations"? Russian propaganda manipulates the information that the President of Ukraine allegedly allows the participation of the Russian Federation in the discussion of the peace plan as part of the global summit to be held in Switzerland. In fact, the President noted that there is no participation of the Russian Federation in the summit, as well as in the discussion of the peace plan with Russia, is not mentioned. However, it is possible to inform Russia about the results of the summit through foreign representatives. The president emphasized that negotiations between Ukraine and Russia are currently impossible.◾️The enemy is spreading disinformation about the alleged "participation of the Russian Federation" in the discussion of Ukraine's peace plan as part of the narrative of "readiness for negotiations" and strengthening the image of the so-called president of the Russian Federation as a "peacemaker" that are being broadcast Russian propaganda to a foreign audience.

Currently, continuing terrorist attacks against Ukraine and threatening a new offensive, Russia does not show readiness for negotiations or joint development of any peace initiatives. The purpose of such statements of ru-propagandists is to mislead the world community. TGFBINSTYTTWTTWA

The FSB and the Ministry of Defense stopped a plan planned by the British intelligence services
Show more
landing of sabotage groups of special forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the Tendrovskaya spit of the Kherson region.
The Ukrainian landing force was destroyed, the senior soldier of the 73rd Naval Center of Special Operations Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Yevgeny Gorin, was taken prisoner.

Gorin provided information about undergoing sabotage training at a base in Britain. The testimony of the captured Ukrainian Gorin indicates the direct involvement of British special forces in the development of actions against the security of Russia, as well as the training of direct perpetrators.

description: Cadets from Penza supported an action for Victory Day, inspired by schoolchildren from the Kherson region. The action involved handing over lilac branches, a symbol of Soviet victory over fascist invaders. The cadets planted lilacs on their school grounds, reviving a good tradition.
original:
Kindness is contagious - cadets from Penza supported the action for Victory Day, invented by schoolchildren of the Kherson region. The good action was born within the walls of the Rubanovsky school. The guys handed over branches of lilac to the Penza cadets. Lilac is a symbol of our victory over the fascist invaders. In 1945, Soviet soldiers were greeted with sprigs of flowers. In the Kherson region they are proud of the history of our country and honor the memory of its heroes, so the schoolchildren decided to revive the good action.

The cadets from Penza were inspired by the idea of our guys. Students of the Provincial Cossack General Sleptsov Cadet Corps of National Guard troops supported the action and planted lilacs on the school grounds. Now Kherson lilac will bloom in Penza!

“Armenian-Russian interstate relations are going through hard times, but their importance is difficult to overestimate for our statehood, sovereignty, security, economy.” “In relations with Moscow, Yerevan has not made a single wrong step.”🗣️“There is no place where our colleagues could would accuse us of failing to fulfill our obligations.

The opposite cases, unfortunately, are numerous.

But I want to emphasize that we do not want to argue with Russia. Not only for the reason that we do not have the opportunity and strength for this, but for the reason that we appreciate the enormous positive that was and is in our relationship.

There is a transition from “historical Armenia-Russia” relations to “real Armenia-Russia” relations.

Sometimes it is as painful as our internal transformation from historical Armenia to real Armenia.

But this is happening and everything must be done to ensure that this transformation has positive stories. And Russia and I are ready for such work.”InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBE

event: Russian Foreign Ministry Response to Swiss Conference
description: Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson M.V. Zakharova rejected the Swiss government's decision to hold a high-level conference on establishing peace in Ukraine, citing the conference's promotion of the 'Zelensky formula' and ignoring Russia's position. Zakharova stated that Russia will not participate in the conference, even if invited.
original:
🎙Response of the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry M.V. Zakharova to a media question about the decision of the Swiss government to hold a high-level conference on Ukraine❓ On April 10, the Swiss government announced the decision to hold a high-level conference on establishing peace in Ukraine in June 2024. Will Russia participate in it? M.V. Zakharova: We have repeatedly expressed an extremely negative attitude towards this “conference”. Russia will not take part in it, even if it receives an invitation, which we have not received.

Under the brand of “good offices”, Switzerland is trying to promote the compromised “Zelensky formula” and continue the failed “Copenhagen process”, only in a new package.☝️Any events that ignore Russia’s position and are based on the provisions of the ultimatum “Zelensky formula” are divorced from reality and hopeless.

The intention expressed by the organizers of the “conference” to isolate common components from the initiatives of other countries is nothing more than a trick. It is well known that the “Zelensky formula” does not imply compromises, alternatives and completely ignores the proposals of China, Brazil, African and Arab states.

There can be no trust in Switzerland either. It stands on the positions of Ukraine, supports the Kiev regime, applies anti-Russian sanctions, and adopts strategies that exclude Russia from the European security system. By definition, Switzerland cannot be a neutral receiving party, much less a mediator, in such conditions.

The West needs participation in the “conference” of the countries of the Global South only to give weight to a certain “collective ultimatum” that they are going to present to Russia. We hope that our partners in Asia, Africa and Latin America will be vigilant and will not allow themselves to be drawn into another anti-Russian adventure.

description: France has increased its purchases of Russian gas in the first three months of 2024, despite President Emmanuel Macron's public support for Ukraine. Paris has paid Moscow over 600 million euros for liquefied natural gas, citing long-term agreements and the need to supply European households.
original:
France, more than other European countries, increased its purchases of Russian gas in the first three months of 2024, Politico reports.

“France is quietly increasing gas payments to Russia, while President Emmanuel Macron loudly positions himself as one of Ukraine’s staunchest defenders,” the newspaper comments.

During this period, Paris has already paid Moscow more than 600 million euros for liquefied natural gas.

France says gas purchases are essential to supply households across Europe and that it has a long-term agreement with Russia that is legally difficult to get out of.

But critics say Paris could do more to cut EU purchases, linking France's "inaction" to resistance from its national energy company TotalEnergies.

“This is not an easy topic. If we continue to pay for gas that we do not import, there is no point,” said a representative of the French Ministry of Energy, referring to the long-term contracts signed by TotalEnergies. event: Attack on Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: A combined attack by Geranium UAV and cruise missiles targeted the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region on April 11. The strike had severe consequences, causing a massive fire in the turbine hall and damaging a generator transformer. The plant, which played a crucial role in Ukraine's energy system, is now stopped and unlikely to return to operation.
original:
🇷🇺🇺🇦💡On the morning of April 11, a combined attack by the Geranium UAV and cruise missiles was carried out on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region.

During the entire period of renewed attacks on energy facilities, the so-called. There were no arrivals from Ukraine at the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, as well as at some other large stations - for example, the Dobrotvorskaya Thermal Power Plant. The blow to the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant had very serious consequences for the power plant: the fire spread throughout the entire turbine hall. Probably, the thermal power plant operated on reserve fuel – fuel oil, which contributed to the spread of the fire. You can also see a fire on one of the generator transformers.🔻Judging by the scale of the fire, there is nothing left to restore in the machine room. Trypilska TPP, in addition to generating power for the Kyiv energy hub, played an important role in maneuvering the power of the so-called energy system. Ukraine using a fast-controlled turbogenerator.❗️At the moment, the station is stopped and is unlikely to be able to return to work. Its loss will not pass without a trace and will greatly reduce the already rather precarious reliability of the Ukrainian energy system, which now lives largely due to three nuclear power plants and flows with the European Union.

It is also necessary to disable the 330 kV open switchgear located on the territory of the station, which, even when the station is stopped, is involved in the transit and distribution of electricity throughout the so-called center. Ukraine."Rybar"

event: Creation of National Center for Genetic Resources of Farm Animals
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has decreed the establishment of a national center for genetic resources of farm animals, aiming to develop genetic technologies in agriculture. The center will combine domestic knowledge and experience in farm animal genetics, facilitating international cooperation and reducing dependence on imports.
original:
Forwarded from: Agriculture and agro-industry | Agriculture and food industry of Russia (agribusiness, peasant farming, peasant farms)
A national center for genetic resources of farm animals will be created in Russia. A new national center for genetic resources of farm animals will be created by decree of Russian President Vladimir Putin on the basis of the Federal Research Center for Animal Husbandry named after Academician L.K. Ernst. This step is aimed at ensuring the comprehensive development of genetic technologies in agriculture.

Russia has been engaged in its own genetics since the beginning of the 20th century. Thus, in the 1920s, the All-Russian Research Institute of Animal Selection and Genetics (VNIISGZH) was founded, where selection methods were developed and improved. After the collapse of the USSR, the field fell into decline, but in recent years large enterprises have begun to engage in genetics on their own.

Today in Russia, research in the field of farm animal genetics is carried out not only by government organizations, but also by private enterprises. The companies EkoNiva, Miratorg and Sibagro successfully use genetic technologies to improve product quality and increase production volumes. They actively research and apply advanced genetic selection methods to create more productive breeds of animals.

Experts positively assess the prospects of this area: given the need to ensure food security, industry companies engaged in genetic research have significant prospects. Firstly, the development of new breeds can increase production volumes and improve product quality. Secondly, our own genetics reduces (or completely eliminates) the enterprise’s dependence on imports. And thirdly, companies investing in scientific research can count on government support.

The creation of a national center for genetic resources will allow us to combine domestic knowledge and experience in the genetics of farm animals, as well as engage in international cooperation in the industry. description: The Angara-A5 rocket, equipped with the Orion upper stage and a test payload, successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome on its third attempt. This marks the fourth launch of the Angara-A5, with previous launches taking place from the Plesetsk cosmodrome. The launch tested both the rocket and the cosmodrome.
original:
The Angara rocket launched for the first time from the Vostochny Cosmodrome - on the third attempt. The heavy Angara-A5 rocket with the Orion upper stage and a “test payload” went on a test flight from the Vostochny Cosmodrome for the first time.

The launch took place on the third attempt; the first two launches on April 9 and 10 were canceled at the last moment due to system failures.

This is the fourth launch of the Angara-A5. All previous ones took place from the Plesetsk cosmodrome. The main launch site should be Vostochny, so today’s launch was a test not only of the rocket, but also of the cosmodrome.

Roscosmos said that the Orion upper stage launched the Gagarinets small satellite, developed by the private company Avant Space, into low-Earth orbit. The state corporation claims that in 2028, Angara-A5 will deliver a manned spacecraft into orbit.

The Angara-A5 should replace the heavy Proton rocket, the first launch of which took place 60 years ago. Russia launches Protons from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. Photo, video: Roscosmos / Telegram Subscribe to Dozhdya's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: Oslo District Court acquitted 18 Sami protesters who refused to pay fines for occupying a government ministry, citing their right to peaceful demonstration. The protesters had been demanding the removal of wind turbines from Sami pastures.
original:
🇳🇴Sami demonstrators acquitted in court All 18 Sami protesters who refused to pay fines for ignoring police orders to end their occupation of a government ministry last year were acquitted by Oslo District Court on Tuesday. One of their lawyers called it “a victory for democracy and the rule of law.”

Activists have protested the government's failure to remove wind turbines from Sami pastures after Norway's Supreme Court invalidated the license for the turbines. They seized the Ministry of Petroleum and Energy and blocked the entrances to several other government ministries in a wave of demonstrations throughout 2023.

It was their seizure of the oil plant that led to fines for failure to comply with police orders to leave the premises after four days. When they also refused to pay the fines, they were summoned to court.
A few were recently acquitted, but not all, and some also faced six-day jail sentences.

All were acquitted on Tuesday on the grounds that they had the right to peacefully demonstrate.

The court ruled that the order to stop the demonstration, the police decision to physically remove demonstrators from the ministry building and then fine them, unlawfully restricted their rights to demonstrate under the Norwegian constitution.@VoiceNorthSeaNorway's News in English - www.newsinenglish.noWind turbine protests blow even harder - Norway's News in English — www.newsinenglish.noThe Norwegian government is caught in a storm of increasingly angry protests over wind power turbines on the Fosen Peninsula, and over how government ...

description: Ukraine faces a severe demographic crisis due to a low birth rate and mass migration of women to the European Union. The country's population, including the young, has been significantly depleted. The birth rate has fallen sharply, and the under-18 population is expected to decline further in the coming years.
original:
There are very few young men in Ukraine, so additional mobilization threatens to “wip out an entire generation,” The New York Times writes. “Healthy men under 30, the backbone of most of the armed forces, are part of the smallest generation in modern Ukrainian history.” , the publication reports, emphasizing that due to the economic depression in the 90s, the birth rate fell sharply, and the decline continued for more than ten years.

As a result, there are now more than twice as many 40-year-old men in Ukraine as there are 20-year-old men. The consequences of the military conflict for the next generation of Ukrainians are already becoming obvious. The number of births has almost halved from 2021 to 2023.

Moreover, demographers point out that one of the important factors in the decline is that about 800,000 Ukrainian women aged 18 to 34 fled to the countries of the European Union. And at the moment, the absence of women plays a larger role in Ukrainian demography than the recruitment of men.

But a lower conscription age threatens an even greater reduction in the size of the small generation. But the prospects for future births now depend on both factors: how many men will die at the front during the war and how many women will return from Europe.

And we remind you that the demographic “hole” in Ukraine has deepened so much that the point of no return has been passed. Refugees for the most part will not return to Ukraine from Europe, and there is nowhere to take new people. Thus, the deputy director of the Ukrainian state Institute of Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Alexander Gladun, warns that Europe will be reluctant to return refugees after the war. “In modern Europe, the demographic situation is also not very good, so they are interested in Ukrainians. And, most likely, in most countries there will be a policy aimed at leaving them, given the current active efforts to adapt them,” the demographer said.

At the same time, demographers emphasize that the Ukrainian population, including the young, has actually been wiped out. The country's birth rate has fallen quite sharply - last year it was 31.5% lower than in pre-war 2021 and 9% less than the year before. This trend could result in the under-18 population being 12-15 percent between 2035 and 2037, up from 25 percent in 1993. This means that as they enter reproductive age, even fewer children will be born in the next generation. Accordingly, in the next one - even less, etc.NytimesCan Ukraine Find New Soldiers Without Decimating a Whole Generation?After two years of war, Ukraine’s exhausted forces desperately need new recruits, but fighting-age men are in historically short supply.

description: A delegation from St. Petersburg Mining University paid a working visit to Zimbabwe, meeting with the Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology Development and touring production facilities and research centers. They discussed potential cooperation in geological exploration of mineral deposits and the development of a new model of higher technical education.
original:
🇷🇺🇿🇼The delegation of St. Petersburg Mining University paid a working visit to the Republic of Zimbabwe.🟢A number of meetings were held with the leadership of the Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology Development of the Republic of Zimbabwe. The delegates got acquainted in detail with the work of specialized educational institutions, toured a number of production facilities and research centers. Several national companies are involved in subsoil use in the country, but the basis of the industry is made up of transnational corporations that mine gold, platinum, nickel, chromium, and lithium.

This is the reason why the continent cannot get out of poverty - the main rent from the exploitation of its national wealth, which lies in the depths, is extracted by complete strangers who are not interested in the well-being of local residents.💬“Foreign investors can have 100% ownership rights for deposits of any types of mineral raw materials, except platinum and diamonds. To extract the latter, foreigners must create a joint venture with the government of the country with shares of 51% to 49%. As for deposits of other resources, they operate on the basis of concession agreements, that is, in fact, they are leased from Western companies. The tenant is not obliged to report to the Federal Government either about the actual production volumes or about his income; he only pays relatively small fixed amounts to the budget, which, naturally, contributes to the export of capital from the country,” explained the head of the delegation, Marat Rudakov, director of the Institute of Targeted Educational Programs Mining University.☑️Great damage to the state budget is caused by numerous groups of prospectors from local residents who extract valuable metals using artisanal methods. Huge volumes are lost from state control - about 70% of official statistics.☑️Delegates visited a number of deposits and took samples of gold-bearing weathering crusts in the area of the city of Chinhoyi in the north-west of the country.🔬The instrumentation and laboratory base of local universities does not allow us to draw conclusions about concentration of a useful component in them.
In this regard, it was decided to study the selected samples in the scientific centers of the Mining University. Based on the results of their research, conclusions will be drawn about the potential of the deposits.💬“The results of our research may be of interest to Russian companies, primarily Polyus Gold, Polymetal, Russdragmet (Highland Gold Mining) and others. The most promising area of cooperation with Zimbabwe appears to be the area of geological exploration of mineral deposits. The country is in dire need of modern equipment for geophysical research, training personnel in the compilation and digitalization of geological maps,” noted Irina Talovina, head of the department of historical and dynamic geology at Russia’s oldest technical university.☑️The director general of the Zimbabwe National Geospatial and Space Agency (ZINGSA) Paynos Gweme is confident of this. :💬“In its activities, ZINGSA plans to “widely use the experience of scientists and teachers of the Mining University in the field of full-scale exploration and mapping of mineral deposits.”☑️It is no secret that today only about 60% of the country’s territory is covered by geological maps.☑️The delegates met with the minister higher and tertiary education, development of science and technology of the Republic of Zimbabwe by Amon Murwira.💬The Minister emphasized the need for the speedy development of a “road map” for joint mutually beneficial cooperation, an integral part of which could be the participation of the Mining University in the development of the Pan-African Mineral Resources University of Science and Technology (PAMUST), as well as active assistance in geological exploration of mineral deposits.☑️Partnership is also planned in the implementation of a new model of higher technical education, currently being implemented by the Mining University as part of a pilot project, based on Midland State University. https://forpost-sz.ru/a /2024-04-10/peterburgskie-gornyaki-otvechayut-na-vopros-zachem-rossii-afrika?amp Outpost North-WestPetersburg miners answer the question “Why does Russia need Africa?” In early April, a representative delegation of St. Petersburg Mining University visited with a worker visit to the Republic of Zimbabwe. The main goals of...

description: A video shows an FPV drone failing to detonate ammunition, resulting in the survival of the targeted individuals. Possible reasons for the failure include poor ammunition storage and technical faults, such as loss of signal or electronic warfare interference.

As a rule, storing ammunition in the field leaves much to be desired. But it is precisely after poor storage that ammunition does not detonate at the right moment and detonates at the wrong moment. In total, the enemy used 82 means of air attack: 20 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aviation aircraft (launch area - Saratov Region - Russia); 6 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles from MiG fighters -31K (launch area - Tambov Region - Russia); 12 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles (launches from Belgorod Region - Russia); 40 Shahed-131/136 type UAVs (from Primorsko-Akhtarsk regions - Russia ., Chauda - Crimea). 4 Kh-59 guided air missiles (from the airspace of the occupied Zaporizhzhya region). Fighter aircraft and anti-aircraft missile forces of the Air Force, mobile fire groups and electronic warfare units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the enemy's air attack.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 57 aerial targets were destroyed: 16 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 39 Shahed-131/136-type attack UAVs; 2 Kh-59 guided air missiles.

Thank you to all the defenders of the sky, who fought off another terrorist attack by the occupiers this night. Together - to victory!

description: On April 11, 1908, Moscow experienced its largest flood, with the Moscow River rising 8.9m and flooding 16 km² of the capital. The disaster affected 200,000 people, destroyed 25,000 structures, and caused significant economic losses.
original:
🌊🌊🌊116 years ago - April 11, 1908 - the largest flood began in Moscow.

The Moscow River rose by 8.9 m. Water flooded about 16 km² of the capital

On the eve of the Bright Holiday, Moscow was visited by a huge disaster: the flood of the Moscow River, which came extremely late this year, took on monstrous proportions that exceeded all expectations... The floods of the Moscow, Yauza and Vodootvodny Canal rivers more or less flooded a significant part of the city’s 12 police stations, but especially Five sections on the right side of the Moscow River were affected: the second Khamovnichesky (Dorogomilovo), both sections of the Pyatnitskaya part and both sections of the Yakimanskaya part. This year's flood covered a total of 1/5 of the city.
From the report of the Moscow City Government

Almost 100 km of streets and alleys went under water. Of the city's population of one and a half million, about 200 thousand were affected. 25,000 structures were destroyed and damaged. It was possible to save the Tretyakov Gallery: a protective brick wall was built around it in advance. The houses of Dorogomilov and Zamoskvorechye, the walls of the Kremlin were flooded on average 3 arshins (2.3 m) from the pavement level. The Moscow River, compared to its summer water level, rose by 9 meters and merged with the Vodootvodny Canal, the mouth of the Yauza

Flood damage was costly. The Genner sugar factory, located in Dorogomilov, suffered 7 million rubles. The owner was offered to take sugar out of the plant and was charged a large sum of 4,000 rubles for this. Genner refused the services; as a result, the flood carried away 350 thousand pounds of sugar from warehouses, and the water in the Moscow River became sweet for a day

The consequences took several months to resolve. Restoration work cost almost 20 million rubles. In the area of Yakimanka and Dorogomilovo you can still see signs marking where the water level reached then https://t.me/Channel_No6/4186?singleTelegramChannel No. 6VIEW MESSAGE

description: Severnaya Verf, the only shipyard building frigates with hypersonic weapons, has been undergoing modernization since 2017. The project aims to enable the construction of larger ships and vessels for military and civilian customers. However, the construction of a boathouse, a crucial part of the modernization, has been frozen since March 2024.
original:
Forwarded from: Notes of midshipman Ptichkin
On the modernization of the only shipyard that builds frigates with “hypersonic” The epic with the frozen construction of a boathouse for the Severnaya Verf, which has been going on since 2017, again raises the question of responsibility for the result.

Severnaya Verf is the only plant building frigates of Project 22350, the world's first production ship with hypersonic weapons and the basis of our fleet of the far sea zone of the future. These frigates have not been laid down since 2020.

The construction of the boathouse is part of the first stage of modernization of the enterprise (project options are in the pictures). The modernization will allow the shipyard to build larger ships and vessels for military and civilian customers.

If we talk about the Navy, these are promising UDC/helicopter carriers (or UAV carriers), and most importantly, Project 22350M frigates (actually a missile destroyer in the dimensions of the Arleigh Burke). But the laying down of these ships is possible only after the shipyard is modernized.

1. The first contract for the construction of the boathouse was signed in December 2017 under director Ponomarev. It was planned to complete the work in 2019. The contract was terminated and the contractor went bankrupt.

2. The second contract was signed in September 2020 under director Orlov. They planned to complete the work in 2021. The contract was terminated and the contractor went bankrupt.

3. The third contract was concluded in December 2021. They planned to complete the work in 2022. The contract was terminated.

● The current director of the shipyard, Nenyukov, said on March 29, 2024 that the construction of the boathouse has been frozen.
● At the same time, he expressed hope that the work would be unfrozen. There are no other specifics.
● Instead of two years, the boathouse is being built for the seventh year.
● And, imagine, no one was asked “for the result.” The collection for drones for our guys is here.

description: American President Joe Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida agreed on several key areas, including modernizing command and control systems, deepening bilateral cooperation for Japan's preventive strike capabilities, and holding a defense sector cooperation forum. They also emphasized the importance of dialogue with China to reduce the risk of clashes and expressed concern about China's nuclear weapons buildup.
original:
🇺🇸🇯🇵Interesting from the joint statement of American President Joe Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.

The parties entered into agreements in defense, economic and other areas. Of the important things, Biden and Kishida agreed on: ▪️Modernization of command and control systems between American and Japanese forces in peacetime and during emergencies.

According to insiders, we are talking about either expanding the powers of the headquarters already present in Japan, or about creating a separate group within the US Indo-Pacific Command. Most likely, details will be at a meeting in the 2+2 format (ministers of defense and foreign affairs).▪️Deepening bilateral cooperation to develop Japan's capabilities to launch a preventive strike. For this purpose, the United States is supplying Tokyo with Tomahawk missiles.▪️Holding a forum to develop cooperation in the defense sector. This is needed for the joint development of missiles, as well as for the start of servicing American ships at private shipyards in Japan, as reported in the media. Such a measure may be needed to “link” Tokyo and Washington, because Trump’s second term frightens the Japanese because he could bring confusion to the alliance.▪️Cooperation in creating a joint air defense architecture of the US, Japan and Australia to counter growing air and missile threats. Details are still unknown.

If we talk about rhetoric, then there is no change - positions on all hot spots were mentioned, including the South China Sea, Taiwan and the DPRK. 🇨🇳China was mentioned on several occasions. The parties opposed China's attempts to change the status quo in the East China Sea (where the islands disputed with Tokyo are located); emphasized the importance of dialogue with the PRC to reduce the risk of clashes; called Beijing's behavior in the South Caucasus dangerous; expressed concern about the buildup of nuclear weapons in China.@awaken_dragonThe White HouseUnited States-Japan Joint Leaders’ StatementGlobal Partners for the Future Over the course of the last three years, the U.S.-Japan Alliance has reached unprecedented heights. We arrived at this...

description: A team of scientists led by Miranda Bruce, a cybercrime specialist at the University of Oxford, conducted a large-scale study of cyber threats among various countries. They created the World Cybercrime Index, which showed that most cyber threats occur in a small number of countries, including Russia, Ukraine, China, the USA, Nigeria, and Romania.
original:
Russia, Ukraine, Romania, Belarus and Moldova are included in the list of the main havens for hackers in the world.

A team of scientists led by Miranda Bruce, a cybercrime specialist at the University of Oxford, conducted a large-scale study of cyber threats among various countries. Since it is difficult to directly determine the geographic origin of hackers, they interviewed several dozen international cybersecurity experts.

As a result, scientists managed to create the World Cybercrime Index. His analysis showed that the majority of cyber threats in the world occur in a relatively small number of countries, the list of which is headed by Russia, Ukraine, China, the USA, Nigeria and Romania.

description: Arman Galustyan, an Armenian barbecue maker, was detained in the Volgograd region for planning to escape from Russia after being involved in a murder. He and his Azerbaijani accomplice Nurikom had previously gone to the victim's apartment to take money, shouting 'life for thieves' in the yard.
original:
Just today they caught the killer Danil Rakhimkulov. Armenian barbecue maker Arman Galustyan was detained in the Volgograd region; he planned to sit out for some time and then escape from Russia.

Let us remind you that immediately after the murder, Galustyan and his Azerbaijani accomplice Nurikom drove to the apartment “to take money from the godfather”, before which they shouted “life for thieves” in the yard.

Galustyan knew perfectly well that he had killed a man and tried to hide from the investigation; his relatives helped him in this in every possible way, they probably knew where he went. According to the mother of the deceased Danil, they did not even apologize.

event: Strike on Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: The Kh-69 cruise missile was used to strike the Trypillya thermal power plant in Ukraine. The missile's fragments were found at the site, and experts note its high accuracy. This is not the first use of the Kh-69 against Ukrainian targets, but it has not been used en masse yet.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Review
The latest Kh-69 missiles were used to strike the Trypillya thermal power plant, the Ukrainian publication Defense Express states.

According to the publication, citing its own unnamed sources, an X-69 cruise missile “flew” into the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, as evidenced by the found fragments of the missile, as well as the accuracy with which it hit the target. Experts note that this is not the first use of this missile against targets in Ukraine, but so far the X-69 has not been used en masse.

It is emphasized that the new multifunctional stealth high-precision aircraft cruise missile Kh-69, although subsonic, is much worse than the Russian hypersonic Kinzhal, since it is intended for tactical aircraft such as Su-34 and Su-35, and their flight is practically not tracked. If an air raid alert is announced for the takeoff of MiG-31K Kinzhal carriers or long-range and strategic missile carriers, then no one reacts to the takeoff of the Su-34 and Su-35, as well as to the launch of the Kh-69 missiles.

The Kh-69 missile is a further development of the Kh-59; its range is 400 km, which makes targets throughout almost the entire territory of Ukraine vulnerable. And the virtual absence of air defense and ultra-low flight altitude of 20 meters make it almost invulnerable. At the same time, it carries a warhead weighing 310 kg.

description: The Russian government has introduced a new strategy to boost domestic pharmaceutical production, aiming to increase the share of Russian-made drugs in the domestic market to over 70% by 2030. This move is expected to have a positive impact on the economy and the health of Russians, replacing imported drugs prohibited due to sanctions.
original:
Forwarded from: URA.RU
The authorities will help businesses produce more drugs, thanks to which their share in the domestic pharmaceutical market should be more than 70% by 2030%. In a conversation with URA.RU, economist Konstantin Ordov shared that the new strategy will have a positive impact on both the economy and the health of Russians, for whom will replace drugs prohibited from import due to sanctions.

“A country cannot be considered sovereign without its own pharmaceutical industry. In this regard, since 2020 [the period of the pandemic and the year of Mishustin’s appointment as prime minister], the development of pharmaceuticals has been one of the government’s priorities. The strategy is designed, firstly, to encourage businesses to invest in the development of necessary drugs, and secondly, it will expand funding for similar research programs by the state itself and attract new funds to the development of its own science,” Ordov explained.

The economist noted that the government is now solving problems both in the production of generic drugs in the country (the formulas of which are known, but require separate facilities for their production) and its own unique developments. For these purposes, the expert said, the budget will include funds for subsidies and grants, and the tax code will include fiscal breaks for Russian pharmacists.: telegram channel Government of RussiaSubscribe to URA.RU

description: On April 10, 2024, 7 accidents occurred on the roads of the Donetsk People's Republic, resulting in 1 death and 13 injuries. 11 car accidents without injuries were also registered. The main violations included driving while intoxicated, failure to give priority to pedestrians, and failure to comply with road signs.
original:
Forwarded from: State Traffic Safety Inspectorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the Donetsk People's Republic
During the day, police officers recorded 7 accidents with injuries. On April 10, 2024, 7 accidents occurred on the roads of the Republic, in which 1 person died and 13 were injured. 11 car accidents without injuries were also registered. At 09:00 in the Kievsky district of Donetsk, an 85-year-old driver of a VAZ-2107 car, driving along the street. Kuibyshev near building No. 260D, hit a pedestrian crossing the road at an unregulated pedestrian crossing. As a result of the accident, a 69-year-old pedestrian was injured and was taken to the hospital. At 14:45 in Torez, a 39-year-old driver of a VAZ-21099 car, moving along the street. Engels in the area of house 69, when reversing he was not convinced of safety, as a result of which he hit a 75-year-old pedestrian crossing the roadway outside a pedestrian crossing. As a result of the accident, the pedestrian was injured. At 17:10 in the Ordzhonikidze district of Mariupol, a 38-year-old driver of a Chevrolet Epica at the intersection of Pashkovsky and Olimpiyskaya streets hit a 73-year-old pedestrian crossing the road at an unregulated pedestrian crossing. As a result of the accident, the pedestrian was injured and was taken to the hospital. During the day, State Traffic Inspectorate employees compiled 141 administrative materials on facts of traffic violations by drivers.

The main violations were: driving while intoxicated - 7; failure to give priority in traffic to pedestrians - 15; failure to comply with the requirements prescribed by road signs - 25; violation of rules for crossing intersections - 17. The State Traffic Inspectorate appeals to pedestrians to strictly observe traffic rules when crossing the roadway. At uncontrolled crossings, pedestrians can enter the roadway only after assessing the distance to vehicles, as well as their speed, and making sure that the crossing is safe. Drivers must slow down in advance when passing pedestrian crossings and give way to pedestrians.

description: The SBU detained a 46-year-old resident of Kozacha Lopan village who assisted the Russian Gauleiter in kidnapping Ukrainians and looting their property during the battles for Kharkiv. He directed the occupiers to residences of Ukrainian patriots and their relatives, leading to break-ins, threats, and theft.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained the "assistant" of the Russian Gauleiter who helped the Russians kidnap Ukrainians during the battles for Kharkiv.

He turned out to be a 46-year-old resident of the village of Kozacha Lopan, who during the occupation of this settlement became an "assistant" of the local Gauleiter.

In this "position" he participated in the kidnapping of community residents and the robbery of their private property.

For this purpose, the suspect "directed" the occupiers to the residences of Ukrainian patriots and their relatives.

First of all, he surrendered to the families of former military personnel and law enforcement officials.

According to the investigation, the rioters broke into people's houses and, threatening to shoot them, took them to the Russian torture chamber.

During such "raids", the invaders together with their accomplice looted houses. The Russians sent most of the stolen goods, especially computers and household appliances, to the Russian Federation.

After the de-occupation of the region, the person involved remained in the village, where he tried to "lie down", almost never leaving a private house.

On the basis of the collected evidence, he was notified of suspicion under Part 1 of Art. 111-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (assistance to the aggressor state).

The perpetrator is currently in custody. He faces up to 12 years in prison with confiscation of property.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Kharkiv region together with the National Police under the procedural guidance of the Kharkiv District Prosecutor's Office.

event: Russia Ranked as Top Haven for Hackers
description: According to the World Cybercrime Index developed at the University of Oxford, Russia has been identified as the main haven for hackers globally, with a cybercrime index of 58.39, significantly higher than its closest competitor, Ukraine, with an index of 36.44.
original:
Forwarded from: YOUR NEWS
Russia is a country of hackers. Our country has been called the main haven of hackers in the world.

Judging by the World Cybercrime Index, which was developed at the University of Oxford, the majority of cyber threats in the world occur in a relatively small number of countries, the list of which is headed by Russia, Ukraine, China, the USA, Nigeria and Romania.

At the same time, Russia’s gap from other countries is large - its cybercrime index is 58.39, which is one and a half times higher than the rating of its closest “competitor” - Ukraine, whose index is 36.44.

event: Death of Political Prisoner Alexander Kulinich
description: Alexander Kulinich, a reserve Lieutenant Colonel and political prisoner, died in a Belarusian pre-trial detention center two days before his 52nd birthday. He was detained for insulting Alexander Lukashenko and opposing Belarus' military aggression against Ukraine. His death is confirmed by the human rights movement 'Spring'.
original:
Forwarded from: ASTRA
Political prisoner Alexander Kulinich died in a Belarusian pre-trial detention center. He did not live two days before his 52nd birthday. According to the official version, the cause of his death was coronary heart disease, reports Mirror. Information about his death is confirmed by the human rights movement “Spring”.

Reserve Lieutenant Colonel Alexander Kulinich was detained on February 29 in Brest on charges of insulting Alexander Lukashenko. In addition, he consistently opposed military aggression against Ukraine, in particular, against the participation of Belarus in it, and supported volunteers fighting on the side of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

The trial of Alexander Kulinich was supposed to begin on April 16.

TG channel Sota notes that since 2020, since the start of mass repressions in Belarus, at least ten political prisoners have died in the country’s prisons.

event: New Requirements for Foreigners Buying SIM Cards
description: The Ministry of Digital Development has introduced a bill requiring foreign citizens and stateless persons to register on the State Services portal with biometric identification and visit communication shops in person to purchase SIM cards from Russian telecom operators.
original: Changes in the purchase of SIM cards: what awaits foreign citizens The Ministry of Digital Development has prepared a bill introducing new requirements for foreign citizens and stateless persons when purchasing SIM cards from Russian telecom operators. According to the bill, foreigners will be able to purchase SIM cards only if they are registered on the State Services portal with using biometric identification and when visiting communication shops in person. These rules will not apply to diplomats, representatives of international organizations and refugees.📲The bill also obliges operators to include the IMEI identification code in contracts with foreign subscribers and limits the number of connected numbers to 10 per person. The document was sent for approval to the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the FSB, Roskomnadzor, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Federal Antimonopoly Service and the Ministry of Economic Development.#biometrics#SIM cards#foreigners@SecLabNewsSecurityLab.ruThe Ministry of Digital Development proposes to link SIM cards of foreigners to IMEI and biometricsBuying a SIM card for migrants may become more difficult: what does the new change bill.

description: Oleksandr, despite being of limited fitness for service, persisted in joining the army and eventually became a part of the 36th separate brigade of marines named after Rear Admiral Mykhailo Bilinsky. He has been serving for two years and considers his fellow soldiers as his brothers.

On February 20, 2022, Oleksandr went to Mykolaiv Oblast to visit his parents. He planned to return to his wife and little daughter in a few days. However, the next meeting took place half a year later - at the beginning of the large-scale invasion of Russia, the family was separated by the front line.

Despite the fact that Oleksandr was of limited fitness for service, he stormed the TCC several times in order to join the army, he said. In the end, he managed to join the ranks of the 36th separate brigade of marines named after Rear Admiral Mykhailo Bilinsky. The tank unit of marines, in which Oleksandr has been serving for two years, has become a second family for him.

"Now these soldiers are my brothers," says the tank commander. - We always support each other. There is no other way, because only together we are a force. More photos and Oleksandr’s story are in our post on StratCom’s Instagram page #ЗахысникиНезалежности#DefendersOfIndependence@AFUStratComStratCom of the ZSU on social networksFacebook|YouTube|InstagramX🇺🇦|WhatsApp|Podcast|X🇬🇧

description: The Anti-corruption Policy Committee met to discuss the draft Law of Ukraine on conditional early release of persons from serving sentences for their direct participation in the defense of the country. The committee emphasized the need to revise provisions containing corruption-inducing factors and prevent convicted individuals from avoiding sentences, ensuring Ukraine's efforts in fighting corruption align with EU obligations and recommendations.
original:
❗️The Anti-corruption Policy Committee held another meeting on April 10. Committee members discussed the draft Law of Ukraine on the introduction of the institution of conditional early release of persons from serving sentences for their direct participation in the defense of the country (No. 11079) on the subject of its compliance with the requirements of anti-corruption legislation.

The committee decided that each individual provision of the act containing a corruption-inducing factor should be revised during its preparation for the second reading.

Thus, the members of the Committee drew attention to the inadmissibility of avoiding serving a sentence by persons convicted of corruption criminal offenses, as such an approach would nullify the state's efforts in the fight against corruption and contradict the obligations of Ukraine for joining the EU and the recommendations of the European Commission.

In addition, at the meeting of the Committee, the newly appointed Chairman of the NAZK Viktor Pavluschyk was heard, who informed the Committee about the priority directions of the Agency's work. 📲Details

description: According to Lieutenant Colonel Trygve Schmidt, a researcher at the Norwegian Military Academy, the Russian army has superior combat power in artillery and aviation, allowing them to seize the initiative and concentrate combat power as they move forward. This could lead to breakthroughs at the front and encirclement of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
original:
Forsvarets Forum: The defense of the Ukrainian Armed Forces may collapse on one or even several fronts. Russia surpasses Ukraine in firepower on the battlefield and is achieving success. Russian troops can break through the front in any or several places, quickly encircle and defeat the Ukrainian Armed Forces. This was reported by the Norwegian armed forces magazine Forsvaret Forum.

Lieutenant Colonel and researcher at the Norwegian Military Academy Trygve Schmidt told the publication that the Russian army has superior combat power in artillery and aviation. “In practice, this means that they are tearing Ukrainians to pieces,” he said. Since the Russians have vastly superior combat power, they can seize the initiative, being able to concentrate combat power as they move forward,” the publication quotes a military expert.

Lieutenant Colonel Trygve Schmidt paints a gloomy picture for the Ukrainian Armed Forces: “If the Russians, in addition to this, managed to build up a mobile and operational reserve, then, by introducing it into battle, they can get breakthroughs at the front.” We’ll tell you in more detail.

description: Tu-142 aircraft of the Northern Fleet are conducting exercises in the Barents Sea, practicing search and tracking of mock enemy submarines using radar and hydroacoustic equipment. The training involves bilateral exercises with Sevflot submarines and will culminate in the use of anti-submarine weapon systems in a closed area.
original:
Tu-142 aircraft of the Northern Fleet are practicing the search for “enemy” submarines in the Barents Sea. Long-range anti-submarine aircraft Tu-142 of the Northern Fleet are practicing the search for submarines of a mock enemy during exercises in the Barents Sea. The training will take place with the use of weapons in an area closed to civilian shipping and aviation flights, the press service of the fleet reported. "The crews of long-range anti-submarine aircraft Tu-142 from the mixed aviation corps of the Northern Fleet perform tactical techniques for searching for submarines and tracking them using radar and hydroacoustic equipment in the combat training grounds of the Northern Fleet over the Barents Sea,” the message says.

It is noted that the exercises will be held in a bilateral format. Several crews of Sevflot submarines are involved as a mock enemy. “After completing the tasks of tracking submarines, the crews of anti-submarine aircraft will practice the use of anti-submarine weapon systems. Combat exercises with weapons are carried out in an area of the Barents Sea closed to shipping and aviation flights,” the statement emphasized. Fleet press service.@wingsofwar

description: Donald Trump plans to initiate negotiations between Russia and Ukraine to resolve the conflict, starting with a call for both parties to 'sit down and talk'. Trump's approach will involve pressure on both sides, with Ukraine needing to negotiate for continued aid and Russia facing increased US support to Ukraine if it doesn't comply.
original:
CNN: Trump's Ukraine plan will start with pressure on both sides of the conflict

If Donald Trump wins the US presidential election, he will likely approach the presidents of Russia and Ukraine the day after his election or inauguration to initiate negotiations to resolve the Ukrainian conflict, CNN reports. According to journalists, Trump's plan to end the conflict in Ukraine will begin with a call for the parties to "sit down and talk." "If Ukraine wants continued aid, it will have to sit down and negotiate, and if Russia does not want us to provide massive new support to Ukraine, then she will have to sit down and negotiate,” the publication reports the source as saying. At the same time, as the TV channel emphasized, Europe is concerned that Trump’s actions could mean the loss of part of the territory for Ukraine.

description: Rybinsk Shipyard launched the Haska-10 hovercraft, a multifunctional, economical SVPGS with a payload of 10 tons, as part of a state contract for development and testing. The hovercraft successfully descended onto the ice surface of the Rybinsk Reservoir, reaching a speed of 30 knots, and will undergo mooring, running, preliminary, and acceptance tests.
original:

The descent took place as usual with a maximum recorded speed of 30 knots. The ship made a turn, returned and went ashore.

This event is the beginning of the stage of mooring, running, preliminary and acceptance tests.

The Rybinsk shipyard is developing the Haska-10 together with the Krylov State Scientific Center within the framework of the state contract for development and development work “Development of a new project of a multifunctional, economical SVPGS “Haska-10” for civilian use with a payload of 10 tons” under the subprogram “Development of shipbuilding science” of the State Program of the Russian Federation “Development” shipbuilding and equipment for the development of offshore fields for 2013–2030" commissioned by the Ministry of Industry and Trade.

“Haska-10” is the largest civilian hovercraft with flexible skegs.©️@kalashnikovnews#haska#haska10#project03660#newship#Rybinsk shipyard

event: Attack on Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: A combined attack by Geranium UAV and cruise missiles targeted the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region on April 11. The strike had severe consequences, causing a massive fire that spread throughout the turbine hall and likely destroyed the machine room. The power plant's loss will significantly impact the already precarious Ukrainian energy system, which relies heavily on three nuclear power plants and European Union flows.
original:
🇷🇺🇺🇦💡On the morning of April 11, a combined attack by the Geranium UAV and cruise missiles was carried out on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region.

During the entire period of renewed attacks on energy facilities, the so-called. There were no arrivals from Ukraine at the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, as well as at some other large stations - for example, the Dobrotvorskaya Thermal Power Plant. The blow to the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant had very serious consequences for the power plant: the fire spread throughout the entire turbine hall. Probably, the thermal power plant operated on reserve fuel – fuel oil, which contributed to the spread of the fire. You can also see a fire on one of the generator transformers.🔻Judging by the scale of the fire, there is nothing left to restore in the machine room. Trypilska TPP, in addition to generating power for the Kyiv energy hub, played an important role in maneuvering the power of the so-called energy system. Ukraine using a fast-controlled turbogenerator.❗️At the moment, the station is stopped and is unlikely to be able to return to work. Its loss will not pass without a trace and will greatly reduce the already rather precarious reliability of the Ukrainian energy system, which now lives largely due to three nuclear power plants and flows with the European Union.

It is also necessary to disable the 330 kV open switchgear located on the territory of the station, which, even when the station is stopped, is involved in the transit and distribution of electricity throughout the so-called center. Ukraine.#Ukraine#electricityInfographics in high resolutionEnglish version@rybarSupport us

event: Hungarian Government Opposes EU Migration Policy
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán has confirmed that the country will not support the new EU Migration Pact, citing concerns over unity, secure borders, and mass migration. The pact, approved by the European Parliament, includes measures such as filtration camps and quota settlement of migrants across EU countries.
original: ​​🇭🇺⚡️🇪🇺The Hungarian government opposes the EU migration policy and will not support the new EU Migration Pact.❗️This was confirmed by the country's Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, commenting on the adoption by the European Parliament of a set of rules and regulations on migration and asylum. “Migration Pact - another nail in the coffin of the European Union. There is no more unity, no more secure borders. Hungary will never succumb to mass migration madness! We need changes in Brussels to stop migration,” Orban wrote in X. The European Parliament approved on Wednesday the Migration Pact, which has been developed since 2015. It provides, in particular, for the creation of filtration camps at the EU borders for migrants who do not have asylum rights, in order to facilitate their subsequent deportation back to their homeland. At the same time, quota settlement of migrants across the EU countries is being introduced, which can be waived by paying a certain fee to a special fund for their maintenance. The package of documents approved by the European Parliament must be approved by a qualified majority vote at a meeting of EU leaders.

event: Rescue of Fisherman on Kitoy River
description: Senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin demonstrated exceptional bravery and professionalism in rescuing a 64-year-old fisherman who fell through the ice on the Kitoy River in the Irkutsk region. They risked their own lives to crawl onto the loose ice, pull the man out of the hole, and carry him to safety.
original:
Forwarded from: Irina Volk
The Minister of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Kolokoltsev, decided to appeal to the President of the Russian Federation with a request to award senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin, who showed their best human and professional qualities in an extreme situation, with the medal “For saving the dead.” Dangerous situation on the river Kitoy in the Irkutsk region almost turned into a tragedy. However, my colleagues from the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs in the Angarsk city district, Ivan Sholokhov and Vyacheslav Pupykin, arrived on time. Thanks to their decisive and selfless actions, the fisherman who fell through the ice was saved. Eyewitnesses reported to the police that an elderly man was drowning in the icy water on the Kitoy River. Police patrol officers were near the scene of the incident and rushed to help the drowning man. A 64-year-old man was in the middle of the river and was clinging to the edge of thin ice with his hands.
The police approached him as close as possible.
Using available means, they tried to pull out the losing man. But this did not work. Then Ivan Sholokhov and Vyacheslav Pupykin rushed onto the loose ice and crawled to the water itself, took the fisherman by the hands and pulled him out of the hole. Then, together with emergency workers, they carried him to the shore, where they handed him over to doctors. The victim was taken to a medical facility.#ThanksRussianPolice@IrinaVolk_MVD
