description: A conversation about the importance of education in aircraft modeling and radio engineering highlighted the significance of nurturing talent in unmanned technology. The discussion emphasized the need for skilled specialists in this area, which is crucial for modern warfare.
original:
Forwarded from: Time_of_Tremor
Nurturing talent in the field of unmanned technology: The importance of education in the field of aircraft modeling and radio engineering.

The other day I started talking with a group of like-minded people about aircraft modeling and radio engineering in the USSR. In those days, it was fashionable to understand these issues, there was appropriate training and interest among both teenagers and adults. - Yes, we should have pioneers, not like they sent out planes with homemade drones, they would even wind the wire on the motors themselves, I remember , this was also taught. Various antennas and what the front needs now. Undoubtedly, these skills are very useful in modern warfare, it is in demand as never before. In the past, almost every child could assemble an airplane and knew what circuit boards and radio engineering were. Many minds were allowed to develop and develop other minds. It is thanks to this, according to the drawings of Soviet scientists and engineers, that we have modern technology, aircraft, energy and much more. - Already in the USSR, the first unmanned jet fighter was made, and not a test one, but which was in service. Then the union fell apart, and they disappeared somewhere; recently, such an enemy flew almost 2.5 thousand kilometers to our rear. Where did this direction go and why did it become so irrelevant?

Everything new is forgotten old. And the sooner we remember at least what teenagers knew from the lessons of aircraft modeling and radio engineering, the more successfully we will be able to conduct combat operations.

Drones have truly become a critical component of modern warfare. I would like there to be more capable and talented specialists in this area who would be valued and given the opportunity to realize their ideas. Time_of_Tremor

event: Ruble Becomes Main Foreign Trade Currency
description: For the first time, the ruble has become the primary foreign trade currency of Russia, with a record 38.1% share in imports and 41.6% in exports. This shift is attributed to a decline in yuan payments, marking a significant reduction in Russia's economic dependence on foreign currencies.
original:
Forwarded from: Ailing Economy
Has the future arrived? For the first time, the ruble became the main foreign trade currency of Russia👏The share of the ruble in imports reached a record 38.1%. In exports, the figure is 41.6% - such figures were already in August last year.

The increase in the share of the ruble occurs against the background of a decrease in payments in yuan - for example, the share of the Chinese currency in exports is now 30%, while at the beginning of the year this figure exceeded 40%. The share of the yuan in imports is 32%, at the beginning of the year it was 38%.

We won’t even talk about dollars and euros; the dependence of our economy on these currencies has completely disappeared. And how many years did you only dream about this?

Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
Soldiers of the military police battalion of the 58th Combined Arms Army prevented a series of potential sabotage in the Zaporozhye region. Military police reconnaissance detected an enemy aircraft-type UAV in the air. The drone was intercepted using technical means.

At the site of the UAV crash, sappers from the military police battalion neutralized it. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: Political scientist and serviceman Kirill Sazonov discussed the mobilization law, emphasizing the need for reinforcements due to the lack of people. He highlighted the importance of training new fighters and the acute shortage of ammunition, which has worsened since last summer.
original:
The mobilization law has been needed for a long time because there are not enough people. But there remains a problem with ammunition. Political scientist and serviceman Kirill Sazonov, who is now at the forefront of the Defense Forces, stated this on air “The Topic with Moseichuk.” It’s good that they passed the law. It’s not clear why they waited so long. There are a lot of questions for it - they’re booking it, who will not be mobilized,” he says. At the same time, according to him, the fighting volunteer guys would like to hear about demobilization. “Even those who came yesterday would like to know about it. But we understand that we cannot now simply pack up our things and go home “, he added. According to Sazonov, among the important issues is the training of new fighters, and there are many questions for training centers: “Even in a brigade, people often undergo the latest training much better. Because when you are with brothers-in-arms in your specialty, the training is much more better".

But people in the army are very needed, Sazonov emphasized. Now, due to the lack of people, soldiers spend several days in position and can lose their vigilance: “We need reinforcements, because the guys need to rest. Because a person, when he’s been in the trenches for two days, the task is even such as going to the toilet and don’t “suffocate.”

At the same time, the shortage of ammunition remains acute. Now the Russians have much more shells. Although just six months ago there was parity on the battlefield. “Last summer we reached parity. We saw from intercepted negotiations and interrogations of prisoners that they were in shock. They said that they were bombarded with rockets, shells, mines. The Ukrainians covered them with everything. And then it started to get worse and worse,” Sazonov complains. At that moment, a drone appeared live above the serviceman’s position and he barely managed to turn off the flashlight and take cover.

description: A domestic gas leak caused an explosion in a high-rise building in Krivoy Rog, resulting in the death of a 5-year-old boy and his parents, who were crushed by a wall. The blast also injured seven people and left one person trapped under the rubble.

event: Total Dictation at Moscow Domodedovo Airport

location: Moscow Domodedovo Airport, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
Radio host Oleg Mashkov will read the Total Dictation at Moscow Domodedovo Airport Moscow Domodedovo Airport invites lovers of the Russian language to the site of the Total Dictation - an annual educational event in the form of a voluntary dictation for everyone. This year, the text at the airport will be read by the host of the popular Radio 7 show “Evening on Seven Hills” Oleg Mashkov. AVIA.RU reports this.

“Participants of the action, who wrote a dictation to his baritone voice last year, note that this is a complete pleasure,” the airport press service said.

The author of the Total Dictation in 2024 was the writer, journalist, multiple finalist of the Big Book Award Anna Matveeva. The text will be devoted to diaries - the history of the genre, its features, interesting personalities - authors of famous works in the form of diaries.aviaru.net/n270047

description: Air defense crews of the Vostok group of troops in the South Donetsk direction successfully shot down six HIMARS missiles aimed at civilian targets in the Donetsk People's Republic. One of the downed rockets did not detonate and was later destroyed by Russian sappers.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
Air defense crews of the Vostok group of troops in the South Donetsk direction shot down six HIMARS missiles in a few days. The strikes were aimed at civilian targets of the Donetsk People's Republic.

One of the downed rockets broke into two parts and fell into a field. Its warhead did not detonate. Russian sappers discovered the crash site using an unmanned aerial vehicle. The sappers decided to destroy the dangerous object on the spot, since the crash site was far from peaceful settlements. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: Russian and foreign experts gathered at the Valdai Club to discuss international information security. They emphasized the importance of digital sovereignty, import substitution, and developing new generation quantum computers. The discussion highlighted the need for legislation in international information security and the threat of US digital hegemony.
original: 💻Information technology: threat or opportunity? On April 10, a discussion on international information security took place at the Valdai Club site. Russian and foreign experts took part in it. The moderator was Andrey Bystritsky, Chairman of the Council of the Foundation for Development and Support of the Valdai Club.🔹Igor Ashmanov, President of Kribrum JSC, member of the Presidential Council of the Russian Federation for the Development of Civil Society and Human Rights, noted during the discussion that “all attempts to conclude agreements on UN and ICANN platforms ended in nothing.” He explained that this is mainly prevented by the United States and its allies, because US national legislation does not prohibit the possibility of carrying out cyber attacks on other states. Against this background, Russia must take care of its own cyber and media security, in other words, digital sovereignty.🔹And despite the global situation and sanctions against Russia, our country has achieved some success in strengthening its technological sovereignty. Thus, at the national level, Russia is actively engaged in import substitution and the development of new generation quantum computers, said Ilya Semirikov, head of the scientific group of the Russian Quantum Center, during his speech. According to him, technical developments in the cyber sphere are actively underway in Russia. Arthur Lyukmanov, special representative of the President of the Russian Federation on international cooperation in the field of information security, director of the Department of International Information Security of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, spoke about the possibility of developing legislation in the field of international information security within the framework of international organizations. He recalled that one of the key principles of the UN Charter is respect for the sovereign equality of states, noting that sovereignty should extend to technology. In this vein, Lyukmanov noted the efforts that Russia is making at the international level, conducting explanatory negotiations with countries of the Global South and East regarding the types and nature of cyber threats emanating from other countries. One of the countries that shares Russia’s position on this issue is China. The Chinese point of view was presented in detail by Shen Yi, director of the Cyberspace Management Research Center at Fudan University in China. He is convinced that the main threat in cyberspace lies in US digital hegemony, which, of course, must be fought. But how? Shen Yi believes it is possible to build a security system within the BRICS, and this should become one of the key goals of the organization. https://ru.valdaiclub.com/events/posts/articles/informatsionnye-tekhnologii-ugroza-ili-vozmozhnost/Valdai Club Information technology: threat or opportunity? On April 10, a discussion on international information security took place at the Valdai Discussion Club. Russian and...
